title: Katie Stelmanis
text:
Kaitlin "Katie" Austra Stelmanis (, born 1985) is a <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>-based <a href="Latvian%20Canadian">Latvian Canadian</a> musician, who has performed and recorded both as a solo artist and with the bands Galaxy and <a href="Austra%20%28band%29">Austra</a>. Stelmanis identifies herself as a <a href="lesbian">lesbian</a>.
Career.
Solo career.
She is classically trained and began performing in the Canadian Children’s Opera Chorus at age 10. She was subsequently a member of the band Galaxy, along with <a href="Maya%20Postepski">Maya Postepski</a> and <a href="Emma%20McKenna">Emma McKenna</a>.
Her debut album, "Join Us", was released by <a href="Blocks%20Recording%20Club">Blocks Recording Club</a>, a Toronto-based artistic collective that has supported numerous artists through the years including <a href="Owen%20Pallett">Owen Pallett</a>, <a href="Fucked%20Up">Fucked Up</a> and <a href="Bob%20Wiseman">Bob Wiseman</a>. Her debut single as a solo artist, "Believe Me", was released by <a href="Loog%20Records">Loog Records</a> and <a href="Vice%20Records">Vice Records</a> on 22 June 2009.
In 2008, Stelmanis appeared on <a href="Fucked%20Up">Fucked Up</a>'s album "<a href="The%20Chemistry%20of%20Common%20Life">The Chemistry of Common Life</a>". She also contributed tracks to the compilation albums "<a href="Friends%20in%20Bellwoods">Friends in Bellwoods</a>" and "<a href="Friends%20in%20Bellwoods%20II">Friends in Bellwoods II</a>".
In 2011, she co-wrote and sang on the <a href="Death%20in%20Vegas">Death in Vegas</a> songs "Come Ride With Me", "Your Loft My Acid" and "Witchdance" from the album "<a href="Trans-Love%20Energies%20%28album%29">Trans-Love Energies</a>".
In 2016 Stelmanis delved deeper into writing lyrics and wrote her band Austra's album "Future Politics" primarily alone.
Influences.
Katie Stelmanis told "<a href="Interview%20%28magazine%29">Interview Magazine</a>" that she "was obsessed with classical music" while growing up. She cites artists such as <a href="Radiohead">Radiohead</a>, <a href="Nine%20Inch%20Nails">Nine Inch Nails</a>, and <a href="Claude%20Debussy">Claude Debussy</a>, and <a href="Massive%20Attack">Massive Attack</a> as influences. Additionally, she takes inspiration from <a href="opera">opera</a>, <a href="Chicago%20house">Chicago house</a>, and <a href="Detroit%20techno">Detroit techno</a>.
Personal life.
Stelmanis is of Italian, English and Latvian descent. Her father is Italian and her mother is half-Latvian and half-English.
